newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products mixed, Italian buying lifts fuel.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products mixed, Italian buying lifts fuel.

text.p: Med oil products ended mixed on Wednesday.
In gas oil, Russian heating oil remains very long because of an acute shipping shortage in the Med.
Outright prices slipped 75 cents in late futures weakness that wiped out earlier screen gains.
Traders said up to eight Russian cargoes are on offer between January 23 and February 3 alone. Only one buyer was seen, bidding cif high -$1 for Russian into Koper.

Russian elsewhere is at cif high Med +$1 basis Genoa, around unchanged. Cross-Med rates for a 30,000 tonner of gas oil remain at WSC 250. An Algerian is offered into NWE but high freight has made it difficult to place.
High and low sulphur fuel oil prices were notionally firmer alongside a recovery in NWE prices, and following Italian buying on Wednesday.

An Italian utility was heard to have bought two low sulphur cargoes on Tuesday, at least one of which was from a trader. Dealers said they thought this business had been done at around $118/$119 cif Italy.
Offers on Wednesday were heard out of Northwest Europe at $119 cif.
High sulphur cargoes were very thinly talked.
Gasoline prices edged up a notional $2, tracking higher NWE prices and a stronger crude market.
Local demand for lower octane material and for unleaded to U.S. destinations have also underpinned prices, traders said.
Naphtha was steady to slightly higher but traders said deals were very scarce due to high freight rates. End-users were reluctant to ship material either to the U.S. or to NWE.
